TA1011-d-01-27-88-DRGW.Narrative: NORMAL FLAT YARD SWITCHING WAS TO BE PERFORMED ON THIRTY CARS WITH ONEDRGW SW-1000 CLASS END SWITCHENGINE. TWENTY-SIX OF THIRTY CARS BEING HANDLED WERE 100-TON OPEN TOP HOPPERS LOADED WITH COAL. AIRBRAKES IN ALL THIRTY CARS WERE PREVIOUSLY BLED OFF AND TRAIN LINE BETWEEN ENGINE AND CARS WAS NOT COUPLED. AS DRAFT OF CARS WAS BEING PULLED OUT OF YARD TRACK NO.1 AT DRGW'S NORTH YARD, DENVER, ENGINEER WAS UNABLE TO STOP DRAFT OF CARS WITH INDEPENDENT BRAKE AFTER REACHING APEX SIGN - POINT WHERE DOWNHILL GRADE BEGINS - APPROXIMATELY 1350 FEET FROM SWITCH OF TRACK NO.1. USE OF AIR BRAKES ON THE CARS WAS NOT AVAILABLE TO THE ENGINEER DUE TO THE FACT THAT BRAKE PIPE AIR WAS NOT CONNECTED FROM THEENGINE TO THE CARS. SPECIAL TIMETABLE NO.7, EFFECTIVE MAY 4, 1986, READS: "OPERATION NORTH YARD: SIGN AT MP 2 ON INBOUND-OUTBOUND LEAD, NORTH YARD BEARS WORD "APEX". THIS SIGN LOCATED AT POINT WHERE MAXIMUM GRADE LEAVING NORTH YARD BEGINS. IN SWITCHING MOVEMENTS AT SOUTH END OF NORTH YARD SWITCH ENGINE HANDLING CUTS CONSISTING OF SUFFICIENT CARS TO MAKE IT NECESSARY TO PASS THIS SIGN MUST HAVE SUFFICIENT AIR BRAKES COUPLED AND OPERATIVENoneNoneNone
